title: Understand the Problem
text: To find the fourth term of the binomial expansion, you will use the Binomial Theorem. This theorem helps you figure out each term of the expansion $${\left(a+b\right)}^n$$.

title: Identify Variables and Powers
text: In $${\left(2x-3y\right)}^4$$, identify the first term $$a=2x$$ and the second term $$b=-3y$$. Note that the power $$n$$ is $$4$$.

title: Determine the Combination Coefficient
text: Use C(n,k) to find the combination number where $$C(4,3)=\frac{4!}{3!(4-3)!}$$. What is $$C(4,3)$$?

title: Calculate the First Term's Contribution
text: For the fourth term, calculate $${\left(2x\right)}^{4-3}$$. What is the result of $${\left(2x\right)}^1$$?

title: Calculate the Second Term's Contribution
text: For the fourth term, calculate $${\left(-3y\right)}^3$$. What is $${\left(-3y\right)}^3$$?

title: Combine All Parts to Find the Term
text: Multiply the combination coefficient, the first term's contribution, and the second term's contribution: $$4 \cdot (2x) \cdot \left(-27y^3\right)$$. What does this equal?
